criteria: Understanding of Place Value: Demonstrates comprehension of place value concepts (ones, tens, hundreds, thousands, etc.) and how they relate to the value of digits in a number.
Ability to Read and Write Numbers: Accurately reads and writes multi-digit whole numbers using base-ten numerals, number names, and expanded form.
Comparison of Numbers: Compares two multi-digit numbers based on the meanings of the digits in each place, using >, =, and < symbols to record the results of comparisons.
descriptions: Shows no understanding of place value. Cannot identify the value of digits in a number.
Demonstrates limited understanding of place value. Struggles to identify the value of digits in numbers beyond the hundreds place.
Demonstrates basic understanding of place value up to the thousands place but may make errors when working with larger numbers.
Demonstrates a solid understanding of place value and can accurately identify the value of digits in multi-digit whole numbers.
Demonstrates a strong understanding of place value and can explain the relationship between digits in different places. Can apply this understanding to solve problems.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of place value and can explain its significance in representing numbers. Can apply this understanding to complex problems and real-world scenarios.
Cannot read or write multi-digit whole numbers in any form.
Struggles to read and write multi-digit whole numbers in base-ten numerals, number names, or expanded form.
Can read and write multi-digit whole numbers in base-ten numerals and number names, but struggles with expanded form.
Can accurately read and write multi-digit whole numbers using base-ten numerals, number names, and expanded form.
Can fluently read and write multi-digit whole numbers using base-ten numerals, number names, and expanded form. Can explain the advantages of each form.

Can read and write multi-digit whole numbers using base-ten numerals, number names, and expanded form with exceptional fluency and accuracy. Can apply this skill to solve complex problems and communicate mathematical ideas effectively.
Cannot compare multi-digit numbers or use >, =, and < symbols correctly.
Struggles to compare multi-digit numbers and often uses >, =, and < symbols incorrectly.
Can compare multi-digit numbers with guidance but may make errors when using >, =, and < symbols.
Can accurately compare two multi-digit numbers and use >, =, and < symbols to record the results of comparisons.
Can confidently compare multi-digit numbers and justify comparisons based on the meaning of the digits in each place. Uses >, =, and < symbols accurately.
Can expertly compare multi-digit numbers and provide insightful explanations of the comparisons. Uses >, =, and < symbols accurately and demonstrates a deep understanding of their meaning.
